abstract.p: Edward J Prenner letter on Aug 31 article on United Nations criticism of Australia holds target of UN's human rights zeal will be democracies, not world's rogues and despots

block.p: The criticism of Australia by the United Nations Committee for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination (news article, Aug. 31) should serve as a reminder.
The criticism of Australia by the United Nations Committee for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination (news article, Aug. 31) should serve as a reminder.

There is a movement in the liberal democracies to yield sovereignty to agencies that purport to monitor human rights abuses. Amnesty International, for one, has trained its sights on the United States. Let us not deceive ourselves. Most of the United Nations member countries despise Western democracies, with the United States topping the list.

The targets of the United Nations' zeal will be the democracies, not the rogues and despots of the world. The Western circles who are pressing for an International Criminal Court, for instance, will not see Sierra Leone's machete-wielding criminals in the docket, but American soldiers.
EDWARD J. PRENNER Forest Hills, Queens, Aug. 31, 2000
